lines.text: I will get double pneumonia
You're young fit chaps, nonsense!
I should have listened to my mother, she's always knitting things
Was that how she made you?
[while flying in the air, retreating from battle]
Is that you, Moggy?
Yes, indeed as I live and breathe. You okay?
I've lost my fingers!
That's a bit careless, old boy. Have you ever seen Peter Pan?
What do you mean?
Well, don't you remember Captain Hook? I mean, he got by. I think they can do anything these days
Thanks a lot, Moggy!
How are you going to land?
I don't know. My mother is going to be furious about this!
Any action?
Not here, old boy, It's illegal in this war.
[aerial scene]
Red two, where the hell are you going?
I thought I'd catch last orders... sorry 'Jester' leader.
[Bletchley, Fanny, Uncle and Skull are having a discussion about the shooting down of Red Cross rescue planes]
Far be it for me to question Fighter Command's orders.
But I'm sure you will?
Not at all, sir. But if the Luftwaffe has planes that can pinpoint pilots in the channel, why not us?
We're not supposed to think of everything you know.
Ah, sir.
Does that answer your question?
Absolutely, sir.
Didn't somebody say that war is a nasty business? Quite good for promotion, though.
They used to say women and children first.
Did they? But they can't fly Spitfires, can they?
